resources.string: Ghost Journal

A Spirit is the most common Ghost you will come across, however it is still very powerful and dangerous. They are usually discovered at one of their hunting grounds after an unexplained death. 

Unique Strengths: Nothing 

Weaknesses: Using Smudge Sticks on a Spirit will stop it from attacking for a long period of time. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Spirits, when smudged, are repelled for 180 seconds or about 3 minutes compared to other ghosts, which are typically repelled for 90 seconds 1 min and 30 sec.

A Wraith is one of the most dangerous Ghosts you will find. It is also the only known Ghost that has the ability of flight and has sometimes been known to travel through walls. 

Unique Strengths: Wraiths almost never touch the ground meaning it can't be tracked by footsteps. 

Weaknesses: Wraiths are afraid of Salt and will actively avoid it. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Wraiths can go through walls outside of hunts but not during hunts. 

• Wraiths teleport, often showing EMF Level 2, 25% chance of Level 5. 
 If EMF level 2 occurs far from ghost room, possibly a Wraith. 

• Wraiths no longer step in salt altogether 

• Using salt in the Summoning Circle before summoning can help identify a Wraith. 

• Salt + motion sensors on a doorway. If ghost avoids salt but triggers sensors, likely Wraith.

A Phantom is a Ghost that can possess the living, often summoned by an Ouija Board. It induces fear in those around it. 

Unique Strengths: Looking at a Phantom considerably drops your sanity. 

Weaknesses: Taking a photo of the Phantom makes it temporarily disappear. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Longer blink in hunts 1 to 2 seconds, nearly invisible during hunt. 

• Disappears if you photograph during event Electronic equipment malfunctions wil stop. Players will no longer hear their heartbeats if they happen. The audio of the event continues to play throughout its duration. 

• If you take a photo of a Phantom, the ghost won't appear in the image. 

• Phantoms can wander to a random player's location anywhere on the map. 

• Sanity drops twice as fast when looking at a Phantom. 

• Phantom's infrequent visibility during hunts makes tracking difficult. 

• Looping the ghost is challenging and not recommended. 

• Using Incense to blind the Phantom requires caution, smudging earlier than usual to avoid surprise. Stand at the end of a long hallway for safety.

A Poltergeist, also known as a noisy ghost, manipulates objects to spread fear. 

Unique Strengths: A Poltergeist can throw large amounts of objects at once. 

Weaknesses: Rooms with no movable objects. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Throws items, reduces player sanity by 2% per throw. 

• 100% chance to throw objects during hunts, every .5 seconds. 

• Can create an "explosion" of items in the ghost room. 

• Scatter objects in the room to trigger the Poltergeist's throwing ability. 

• Look for objects being flung with force or multiple objects thrown simultaneously. 

• Create small spread-out piles for better detection. 

• Be cautious of inconclusive behavior; random interactions can mimic Poltergeist activity. 

• Low activity doesn't rule out the possibility of a Poltergeist. 

• Increase activity by turning off the lights.

The singing siren, known for attracting its victims through song. It has been known to single out its prey before making a killing blow. 

Unique Strengths: Banshees will weaken their target before striking. 

Weaknesses: Banshees can sometimes be heard screaming with a parabolic microphone. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Hunts triggered at 50% sanity.


• A Banshee aggressively hunts the target player in the building. If the player isn't present, it hunts others normally. 

• Banshees can wander near their target and enter hunt mode if in their line of sight. 

• Banshees initiate hunts when players enter the building with the low sanity target inside, ignoring avg sanity levels. 
 Can hunt from 87.5% to 12.5% average sanity. 
 Target's sanity drops 15% if specific ghost event conditions are met. 

• Roaming ability has 67% chance to target player during roam. 
 Roaming doesn't leave EMF reading, unlike Phantom's ability. 

• Focuses on one player inside the house. 
 Hunts like a regular ghost if target leaves. 

• Ignores non-targets during hunts. 

• More singing ghost events likely. 

• Distinct parabolic mic sound: scream. 
 33% chance of unique shriek-like sound 

• Use players as bait with Incense or planned escapes to identify target. 
 Bait players attract the ghost using talking or electronics. 
 Multiple players can do this to see who the Banshee targets. 
 Useful when sanity-based method is unclear or on Nightmare difficulty. 
 All players should be indoors for the test.

A Jinn is territorial and attacks when threatened. It can travel at high speeds and is limited by cutting off power via the breaker box. 

Unique Strengths: The Jinn moves faster the further the target is. 

Weaknesses: Cutting off power limits the Jinn's speed. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Breaker on + Line of sight = Increased speed (not as fast as a Revenant or slow without LOS) 

• Turn off the breaker to disable Jinn's ghost powers. 
 But this makes lights go out and sanity drains. Candles can help counter sanity loss. 

• Jinn has a 25% chance to drop a player's sanity within 3 meters. 
\ will give an emf reading at the breaker when this ability is performed 

• Within 3m of player = Normal ghost speed during hunt 

• To identify Jinn: During a hunt, observe speed change in a long room with clear line-of-sight. If it instantly speeds up upon seeing you, it's likely a Jinn. Be cautious if testing its speed within 3 meters. 

• Another way to identify Jinn: Leave a EMF reader at fuse box; if it detects reading without box changing, it's likely Jinn's ability, ruling out other causes.

A Mare primarily attacks in the dark. Keeping lights on and avoiding dark areas lowers aggression, but it attempts to turn off lights to hunt. 

Unique Strengths: Attacks more in the dark, switching off lights. 

Weaknesses: Keeping lights on. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Hunts at 60% with lights off, 40% with lights on 

• Can't turn on lights 

• Higher light breaking event chance 

• Wanders more with lights on in its room 

• Nearby light turns on, Mare might quickly turn it off 
 10-second cooldown, resets if light turned on again 
 Applies to lights, TVs, and computers 

• Mare prefers hunting with lights off, so keep lights on in its favorite room and nearby areas to reduce hunt threshold. 
 Once Mare's sanity threshold is below 40%, it hunts regardless of lights. Leave lights off in its favorite room to concentrate its hunting there. 

•Frequent room changes and wandering into unexplored dark areas may indicate a Mare if lights are usually kept on near the ghost. Especially in Professional and Nightmare

A Revenant is a ghost that can attack indiscriminately regardless of sanity levels when hunting. Hiding from the Revenant causes it to move slowly, but it travels faster than any other ghost if it's hunting a victim. 

Unique Strengths: Attacks anyone regardless of sanity levels; can switch targets while hunting. 

Weaknesses: Moves extremely slowly when players hide. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Track ghost speed through video cameras to identify if it's a Revenant. 

• Sacrifice/delegate a fellow ghost hunter to investigate its speed during a hunt.

A Shade is considered a "shy ghost." It won't attack if multiple people are nearby, but it's harder to find in larger groups. 

Unique Strengths: Extremely shy, hard to find and detect. 

Weaknesses: Doesn't hunt when players are in a group. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Shade hunts at average sanity below 35%. 

• Shades have a VERY LOW chance of hunting when multiple people are nearby, but it's not impossible. 
 Turn off lights, avoid entering ghost room to provoke interactions. 

• Shadow form in ghost events or more airball events. 
 Shade's shadow appearance from cursed items not guaranteed. 

• Event chance rises with lower average sanity. 

• Won't throw objects in the same room. 

• Won't hunt with a nearby player. 

• Test by staying in ghost room with a crucifix. 

• Low sanity, no hunt or crucifix use? Likely a shade. 

• Summoning Circle, Music Box, Monkey Paw can reveal black shadow appearance. 
 Restores full visibility when hunt starts.

A Demon is one of the worst ghosts to encounter. Highly aggressive, it attacks more often than any other ghost. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Can hunt at 70% sanity, with rare early hunts 

• Short 20-second hunt cooldown (others 25 seconds) 

• Smudging stops demon for 60s (others 90s, spirit 180s) 

• A crucifix is recommended to prevent hunts. stops demon within 5m (others 3m) 
 A hunt close to a crucifix suggests it might not be a demon.

A Yurei is a type of ghost that drains player's sanity quicker than any other ghost. Smudging the room prevents it from moving for a long time. 

Unique Strengths: Drains player sanity quickly. 

Weaknesses: Using a smudge stick in the same room stops the Yurei from moving. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Yureis drain sanity during hunts if you're within 10 meters. 

• Zaps 15% nearby player sanity 

• Ability closes room door 
 All ghosts, including Yurei, can shut doors as part of their behavior. Yurei might do it more often due to its sanity drain ability. 
 Yurei's ability affects tent doors, not locker or closet doors. 

• Smudge traps Yurei in Ghost room for 60 sec 

• Keep doors open near the ghost to observe its ability. 

• If a front door closes fully without a ghost event or hunt, it's definitely a Yurei. 

• Verify ghost interaction with EMF Reader to know if ghost touched door. 

• Yurei only closes doors, doesn't open them.

An Oni is a very active ghost, likely to show itself within the first few minutes of the game. It often wanders around near the ghost room. It's recommended to hide in a closet and wait for it to leave. 

Unique Strengths: Oni are more active whilst people are nearby and will drain their sanity faster when manifesting. 

Weaknesses: Oni disappear less often while hunting their prey. 

Tips & Tricks` 

• Can't trigger "ghost mist”/"airball" event, fog ball approaches, hiss sound on collision. Chasing events can also hiss. 

• During Manifestation events: full form shown, not shadowy/translucent. 

• During Hunts: Oni is Visible longer dosent blink as often, easier to take photo of. 

• Double sanity drain during ghost events.

A common type of ghost attracted to human voices, often found in family homes. 

Unique Strengths: Talking near a Yokai angers it and causes it to attack more often. 

Weaknesses: While hunting, it can only hear voices close to it. 

Tips & Tricks 

• 50% sanity hunt or 80% when players talk nearby 

• Voice and equipment detection within 2.5m during hunts 

• Increased activity when talking near a Yokai 

• Test by hiding, yelling/walkie during a hunt; , if ghost is not attracted = likely Yokai 

• Music box proximity before breaking is closer 

• If Monkey Paw unblocks hiding, ghost hears speech/electronics globally, overrides Yokai weakness.

A rare ghost found in hot climates, known to attack more often in cold weather. 

Unique Strengths: Moves faster in colder areas. 

Weaknesses: Moves slower in warmer areas. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Keeping the breaker on slows down the Hantu by keeping the house warm. 

• Hantu speed increases as temperature lowers. 

• No gradual speed increase with line of sight. 

• If you see Ghost breath during hunt Most likely Hantu 

• Breaker turn-off chance higher. 

• Breaker off, freezing breath in any room during hunt. 

• Freezing temps always in Nightmare mode. 

• Avoid ghost room during hunts. Light Snow raises danger. 

• Leaving the breaker on creates high temps slower ghost for looping 

• Loop around furniture during warm hunt; slow speed = Hantu. 

• Freezing breath in dark (breaker off) also IDs Hantu (riskier) 

• Raiju mimics speed with electronics; remove for clarity. 

• Moroi speeds up via lowering average sanity.

A Myling is a very vocal and active ghost. It's quiet when hunting its prey. 

Unique Strengths: Quieter when hunting. 

Weaknesses: Mylings frequently make paranormal sounds. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Stealthy ninja assassin 

• Heard within 12 meters during a hunt (footsteps and vocal noises) 

• Other ghosts heard up to 20 meters 

• Myling responds more on parabolic microphone 

• Test: Hide with flashlight/dots, if only footsteps when equipment flickers, likely a Myling

Using a video camera is the only way to view a Goryo when it passes through a DOTS projector. 

Unique Strengths: A Goryo usually only shows itself on camera if no people are nearby. 

Weaknesses: Rarely seen far from its place of death. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Goryo's dots visible only through video camera. 

• Dots won't appear if you're in the same room. 

• Check for Goryo: no players in room, use camera for dots. 

• Dots forced evidence in Nightmare mode. 

• No dots without video camera means no Goryo. 
 Visible D.O.T.S. evidence on camera but not to naked eye = likely Goryo. 
 D.O.T.S. seen without camera = not Goryo. Adjust brightness for clarity. 

• Goryo stays in its room, consistent favorite room. 
 Sanity wish from Monkey Paw overrides this. 

• Tough to identify on 0 evidence runs. Observe favorite room change or use sensors/salt.

Obake are shape-shifters, taking on many forms, including humanoid shapes. 

Unique Strengths: When interacting with the environment, an Obake rarely leaves a trace. 

Weaknesses: This ghost will shapeshift, leaving behind unique evidence. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Unique 6-fingered fingerprint 
 Two fingerprints on light switch 
 Five fingerprints on keyboards and Prison doors (instead of four) 

•Normal fingerprints don't rule out an Obake. 

• Forced fingerprints as evidence on Nightmare 

• 25% chance of not leaving fingerprints 

• Ability to halve fingerprint duration 

• During hunts, Obake can shapeshift briefly 

• Flash as another ghost model of same gender 

• 6.66% chance to shapeshift with each blink during hunt 

• Test Obake by looping and observing model change 

• Can change ghost model stance during hunt 

• Test by having it run from corridor to check blink change 

• Inconsistent fingerprints suggest an Obake; no prints, then prints on different surfaces. 

• Difficulty settings can affect fingerprints and decay timers.

The Onryo, "The Wrathful Spirit," steals souls to seek revenge. It fears fire and avoids it. 

Unique Strengths: Extinguishing a flame can cause an Onryo to attack. 

Weaknesses: When threatened, this ghost is less likely to hunt. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Can hunt at 60% sanity 

• 3 extinguished flames trigger hunt (Any Sanity) 

• Can't hunt within 4m of flame 

• Test with candles, crucifixes in room 
 Crucifix without candle, not onryo 
 Crucifix after blowing candles, likely onryo 

• May wander, initiate hunt away from candles 

•Dead player: Onryo blows out flames more 
More dead players increase frequency 
No dead players: same as other ghosts 

• less than 60% sanity: more flame blowing, hunting attempt

A Raiju thrives on electrical current, siphoning power from devices. It can be agitated by excess power. 

Unique Strengths: A Raiju can move faster by siphoning power from electrical devices. 

Weaknesses: Constantly disrupts electronic equipment, making it easier to track. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Faster speed near on electronics: 65% with electronics on, 50% without 

• Range of speed increase: 6m on small maps, 8m on medium, 10m on large 

• Hunt malfunctions electronics: at 15m for Raiju, compare to 10m others 

• Prevent early hunts: by removing extra turned on electronics, avoid discarding them on ground during hunts. 

• Watch Raiju and Myling speed near electronics to avoid confusion

These ghosts mimic each other's actions, alternating their attacks to confuse their prey. 

Unique Strengths: Either Twin can initiate an attack on their prey. 

Weaknesses: The Twins often interact with the environment simultaneously. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Can interact with multiple objects in different rooms simultaneously 

• Varied speeds heard during multiple hunts 

• Twins may release a slightly faster (110%) or slower (90%) ghost during a hunt 

• Only one ghost sent out during a hunt 

• Can hunt from a different location using a "decoy" twin

The Mimic is an elusive, mysterious, copycat ghost that mirrors traits and behaviors from others, including other ghost types. 

Unique Strengths: Uncertain capabilities. Treat a Mimic as if it had every possible modifier. 

Weaknesses: Ghost orb sightings near mimics. 

Tips & Tricks 

• The Mimic provides "evidence" of Ghost Orbs in addition to its three main evidence types. 
 Mimic: orbs + 3 (2 on Nightmare) evidences. 

• Orbs always present on Nightmare Mode. 

• Orbs with no evidence. 

• With orbs, always check other evidence to confirm no mimic. 

• Treat a Mimic as if it had every possible modifier is the safest way to handle it. 
 Mimics change ghosts every 30s-2min. 

• Behavior won't change mid-hunt. 
Changing behavior? Check for mimic. 

• Minimize speaking near the ghost (Yokai). 

• Turn off unnecessary electronics (Raiju). 

•Keep the lights on in the Ghost Room (Mare). 

• Have a source of flame in the Ghost Room (Onryo). \n
• Be prepared for possible early hunts (Demon).

Surrounded by fog, Deogen elude ghost hunters. They find hidden prey and stalk them into exhaustion. 

Unique Strengths: Deogen sense the living and move quickly with no player in sight. 

Weaknesses: Require energy to form, move slowly when approaching victims 

Tips & Tricks 

• Deogen's hunt sanity threshold: 40%, not 50%. 

• Can't hide from it. 

• Distinct growl/Heavy breath spirit box response. 
 Deogen maintains continuous line-of-sight during hunts, shifting targets periodically. Incense can temporarily redirect it. 

• Listen to speed change while hiding if it slows down approaching players. 
 Beware of similar behaviors from young Thaye, Revenant, or Hantu. 
 Choose hiding spots that allow easy escape or prepare Incense. 

• Slow near you, easy to loop. 

• More writing and dots chances. 

• Spirit box always on in Nightmare 

• Stunning with smudge sticks maintains slowed speed.

Moroi drain energy from the living and place curses, curable by antidotes or distance. 

Unique Strengths: Stronger with weaker victims, faster at low player sanity. 

Weaknesses: Hyperosmia weakens them for longer periods, smudge sticks blind them longer during hunts. 

Tips & Tricks 

• High speed Speed Demon ghost. 

• Curses on spirit box or parabolic mic response. 

• Curse doubles sanity drain, light/candles don't prevent it. 

• Remove curse with sanity pills. 

• Hunt-blind smudge Time: 12s (Moroi), 6s (others). 

• Lower sanity = faster Moroi. 

• Can Test by: Using Spirit box + light/candle, If sanity draining = Moroi. 

• No-evidence: Faster Moroi as sanity drops. 

• Line-of-sight speed boost, fastest at 0% sanity. 

• Spirit box forced evidence on Nightmare. 

• Listen for speed shifts during hunts or as sanity drops. 

• Use sanity meds to slow it down during hunts. 

• Use sanity monitor to detect excessive sanity drain.

Thaye rapidly age and deteriorate when near the living. They become active and agile when entering a location. 

Unique Strengths: Active, defensive, and agile when entering the location. 

Weaknesses: Weaken over time, becoming slower and quieter with prolonged exposure to the living. 

Tips & Tricks 

• Early Hunter: Hunts at 75% 

• Unique aging ability 
 Starts young, aggressive, fast (2.5m/s), 
 Ages near you every 1-2 mins, slower at old age (15%, 1m/s) 

• No speed increase when Thayes see you during a hunt 

• Monitor hunt speed to identify Thaye 
 If it appears to decrease in speed during hunts, it's probably a Thaye. 

• Ouija board age changes with aging 

• No D.O.T.S Projector within a few minutes = Thaye less likely. 

• If Ghost gives Ghost Writing + D.O.T.S Projector on Nightmare = Thaye (Deogen has guaranteed Spirit Box).
